content: The less confident you are, the more serious you have to act.

The sons of Hermes love to play,
 And only do their best when they
 Are told they oughtn't; 
Apollo's children never shrink 
From boring jobs but have to think
 Their work important.
writer: W. H. Auden, Under Which Lyre

content: The condition of man is already close to satiety and arrogance, and there is danger of destruction of everything in existence.
writer: a Brahmin to Onesicritus, 327 BC, reported in Strabo's Geography

content: Many who burnt heretics in the ordinary way of their business were otherwise excellent people.
writer: G. M. Trevelyan, Bias in History
